name: Psychological Dependency in Movement Followers
description: Understanding how false messianic movements create emotional and mental dependency in their followers.

cards.title: Creating Emotional Dependency Through Fear and Hope
cards.description: Understanding the dual forces of fear-based control and promised salvation.
bulletpoints: How doomsday prophecies create long-term psychological reliance.
The role of emotional highs and lows in controlling group behavior.
False empowerment tactics used to reinforce leader worship.
cards.summaryText: Trace doom-prophecy addiction, mood-swing conditioning, and faux empowerment that binds devotion.

cards.title: The Messiah Complex and False Gurus
cards.description: Decoding the psychological traits of leaders who claim divine or supernatural authority.
bulletpoints: Recognizing the manipulation of archetypal savior narratives.
Understanding how charisma and psychological projection create blind devotion.
The cycle of betrayal and redemption used to retain followers.
cards.summaryText: Expose hijacked savior archetypes, charisma-fueled projection, and churned betrayal-redemption loops.

cards.title: Breaking Psychological Bonds with False Movements
cards.description: Techniques for helping individuals exit belief-based control structures.
bulletpoints: Deconstructing identity attachment to cult narratives.
Cognitive reframing to neutralize guilt-based control methods.
Rebuilding self-reliance outside of hierarchical ideological structures.
cards.summaryText: Coach de-identification from cult myths, reframe guilt triggers, and rebuild autonomous resilience.
